name: dilatant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a substance is dilatant, it becomes more solid under pressure: A mixture of cornflour and water provides an excellent example of dilatant behaviour. All the fluids used in the experiment were dilatant.
More examplesFewer examplesA dense mixture of granules and liquid often shows a severe thickening and is called a dilatant fluid.This causes movement of dissolved silica into the dilatant site in response to low fluid pressures.Dilatant materials, such as clay and sand, expand during shearing.
